document_data.name: Merriolle
document_data.mainbody:
'''Merriolle''' was an inhabitant of the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|Almost coming to blows over a pebble. What's this city coming to? That rag, Baldur's Mouth - it isn't helping. Out to rile people up, I'm almost sure of it.|Merriolle}}
document_data.Description: Merriolle was a [[high elven]] with a pale skin tone, blue eyes, and short, wavy blonde hair.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, during the [[Absolute crisis]], Merriolle found herself among those Baldurians in a crowd who witnessed [[Bastian d'Zinn]], a man of means, accosting the child named [[Rhaneld]] for accidentally hitting him with a rock while playing. Bastian believed that a child playing on a street was a sign of the city's crime-ridden downward spiral. Merriolle was outraged that a simple pebble would almost reduce someone to fisticuffs and believed that the ''[[Baldur's Mouth]] Gazette'' was responsible for riling people up and stoking up hate.
